results.name: Google 'Share' Button
results.overview:
MagePlace offers the Google Share Button extension to be added for your Magento online store. Adjust this button to advertise your online store and make sharing on Google+ easy. MagePlace solution allows your customers to share awesome links with their friends on Google Plus.

With MagePlace Google Share Button extension you will gain the best chance to appear high up in the search results. Help your business to move to the top of the Google search rankings!

Google Share Button can be placed on CMS pages, Category or Product pages. You can also define size, width, and language of the button to be displayed on your e-commerce store pages.

The Google Share Button supports Magento Community and Enterprise editions.

results.name: Google Earth Blog
results.overview: Google Earth Blog is a resource for learning the latest news about Google Earth, including new applications, interesting sights, latest technology, and resources for learning how to make the most of this fabulous 3D geographic browser.   Google Earth Blog provides daily information including when new releases of Google Earth come out, releases of new imagery and layers, describes new technologies and features, or reveals hidden tricks and features.  There is way more to Google Earth than just satellite photos.   Google Earth Blog describes how you can use Google Earth as a mapping tool, weather forecasting tool, astronomy program, flight simulator, storm tracker, online business medium, GPS tracker, photo geotagger, gaming interface, travel planner, travel journal, and more.

results.name: Google Drive (Docs) in Atlassian JIRA Integration
results.overview:
_Google Drive (Docs) in Atlassian JIRA_ allows JIRA users to access, preview, like and locally download Google Drive files in Confluence.

* Secure authentication between Google Drive and JIRA
* Link one or many Google Drive files directly to any JIRA issue
* Preview, open, edit, or even download a local copy of the 
   document.
* Supporting all types: Documents, Spreadsheets,   
   Presentations, Drawings, PDFs
* Edit Google Drive documents direct from JIRA, and save back 
   to Google Drive
* Download local copies of Google documents from JIRA
* This integration is mature and has continued development and  
   support!

This is a packaged “plug and play” integration, developed, supported, and continually sustained by AppFusions. It is installed in small and large corps, world-wide.

Free 30-day supported trials. Request a license key at info@appfusions.com

results.name: Google Connector
results.overview:
With the Google connector users can register or login to Magento shop site with one click using their Google Plus accounts – just as simple as clicking a button once! One step registration proved itself to be convenient and good option with Facebook Connector and Twitter Connector, but we don’t want to limit our customers to the few social networks. User-friendly sites should provide their users with as many options as possible – anything that will make user experience better will add more karma to your site and more revenue for your store.

The Google Connect extension takes customer’s information from Google account directly into Magento and creates Magento account for this user. This way customers save time because they don’t need to fill in all the registration fields for your site.

The Google Connect supports Magento Community and Enterprise editions.

results.name: Google Ventures
results.overview:
Google Ventures is the financially motivated venture capital arm of Google Inc., founded in 2009.

Google Ventures invests in startups in industries including consumer Internet, software, hardware, clean-tech, bio-tech, health care and others. 

They aim to invest about $100 million a year, with deal sizes ranging from seed to late-stage investments of tens of millions of dollars, depending on the stage of the opportunity and the company's need for capital.

Google Ventures currently invests in the U.S. and has offices in Cambridge, Mountain View, New York, and Seattle.

results.name: Google Profiles
results.overview:
Google Profiles is a product that allows users to create a public, searchable profile and social media hub that links to your blog and other profiles such as [Flickr](company/flickr), [Twitter](/company/twitter),  [Google Reader](/products/google-reader), and [Facebook](/company/facebook), among others.

Users can even verify their Google Profiles via Google's [Knol](/product/knol) product in the Preferences section.

results.name: Google Glass
results.overview:
Google Glass is an attempt to free data from desktop computers and portable devices like phones and tablets, and place it right in front of the eyes of the viewer. 

Google Glass is a camera, display,  touchpad, battery and microphone built into spectacle frames so that a display is perched in the wearer's field of vision, allowing him to film, take pictures, search and translate on the go.

The product uses display technology to put information in the upper right corner of view, courtesy of a prism screen, without obstructing vision.  Data is controlled with a microphone and touchpad on one arm of the frame so that users can select what to do with a brief gesture or by talking to the device.  There is 16GB of flash memory built into the device, with 12GB available for user storage.  The device syncs to Google Drive, and Bluetooth and WiFi are built in. 

Google Glass Explorer, the developer version sent out beginning in April of 2013, costs $1,500.

results.name: Google Apps SSO Authenticator for Atlassian Confluence
results.overview:
The _Google Apps Authenticator_ allows users to sign into Confluence using their Google Apps account.

When a login is required for Confluence, users will be able to login either via a normal Confluence account (not recommended in this case) or instead click the new "Sign in using Google Apps".

With this option, users will either auto-sign into Confluence (if they are already signed in to Google Apps) or be redirected to Google to sign in there first.

This is a packaged “plug and play” integration, developed, supported, and continually sustained by AppFusions. It is installed in small and large corps, world-wide.

Free 30-day supported trials. Request a license key at info@appfusions.com

results.name: Google Apps SSO Authenticator for Atlassian JIRA
results.overview:
The _Google Apps Authenticator_ allows users to sign into JIRA using their Google Apps account.

When a login is required for JIRA, users will be able to login using the new "Sign in using Google Apps" option. (or, optionally via a normal JIRA account).

Users will either auto-sign into JIRA (if they are already signed in to Google Apps) or be redirected to Google to sign in there first.

This is a packaged “plug and play” integration, developed, supported, and continually sustained by AppFusions. It is installed in small and large corps, world-wide.

Free 30-day supported trials. Request a license key at info@appfusions.com

results.name: Google[x]
results.overview:
Google X, stylized as Google[x], is a secret facility run by [Google](http://crunchbase.com/company/google) located about a half mile from the corporate headquarters Googleplex in Mountain View, California. Work at the lab is overseen by [Sergey Brin](http://crunchbase.com/person/sergey-brin), one of Google's co-founders.

Source: [Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_X)
